alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ada, south central Boise and west central Elmore Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boise Stage Stop, or 18 miles southeast of Boise, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Boise Stage Stop around 510 PM MDT. Arrowrock Reservoir around 530 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
